intro: Pyxidaria senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese pyxidaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite, simple leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
